CB30:
{{short description|American country music duo}} {{UPE|date=March 2019}} {{Infobox musical artist | background = group_or_band | name = CB30 | image = Cb30 edits-18.jpg | alt = | caption = CB30 in 2018 | alias = | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], USA | genre = Country | discography = | years_active = | label = | spinoffs = | spinoff_of = | current_members = Christian Clementi
Brody Clementi | past_members = | website = {{Official URL|https://www.cb30music.com/}} }} '''CB30''' is an American country music group composed of brothers Christian (born May 30, 2001) and Brody Clementi (born March 30, 2004).{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/entertainment/music/review-cb30-refreshing-on-debut-single-cool-if-you-wanna/article/509537|title=Review: CB30 refreshing on debut single 'Cool If You Wanna' (Includes first-hand account)|date=2017-12-08|access-date=2018-09-30}} The duo’s name is derived from their first initial of each of their first names and the fact that they were both born on the 30th of the month.{{Cite news|url=https://rarecountry.com/performances/a-couple-of-young-country-newcomers-just-blew-our-socks-off-with-this-luke-bryan-cover/|title=A couple of young country newcomers just blew our socks off with this Luke Bryan cover|date=2018-01-11|work=Country Music News, Artists, Songs, and Videos {{!}} Rare Country|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en-US}} == Career == The brothers grew up in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], surrounded by music from a young age, thanks to their father Jay Clementi’s successful songwriting career writing for country singers [[Martina McBride]], [[Darius Rucker]], [[Dierks Bentley]],{{Cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/repertory#ace/search/workID/493398491|title=ACE Repertory|last=ACE|website=www.ascap.com|access-date=2018-09-30}} [[Sara Evans]], [[Luke Bryan]], [[Sunny Sweeney]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/repertory#ace/search/workID/881168469|title=ACE Repertory|last=ACE|website=www.ascap.com|access-date=2018-09-30}} and many others.{{Cite web|url=http://k99.com/luke-bryan-sings-song-written-by-former-unc-football-star-jay-clementi-videoaudio/|title=Luke Bryan Sings Song Written By Former UNC Football Star Jay Clementi [VIDEO/AUDIO]|website=K99 – Colorado’s New Country|language=en|access-date=2018-09-30}} While performing at local charity events in Nashville, the duo was discovered by country superstar Luke Bryan{{Cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/hottest-artists-under-25-2018/|title=2018's Hottest Artists Under 25|website=Taste of Country|language=en|access-date=2018-09-30}} who helped them with music industry connections. CB30 released their debut single “Marina,” in 2016 along with a music video in which Bryan had a cameo.{{Citation|title=Marina - Single by CB30|date=2016-08-19|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/marina-single/1140267770|language=en-US|access-date=2018-09-30}} The duo’s second single, "Cool If You Wanna" was released on November 10, 2017{{Cite news|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/cb30-risks-bean-boozled/|title=CB30 Risks It All in 'Bean Boozled'|date=2017-12-08|work=Sounds Like Nashville|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en-US}} via [[Buena Vista Records]] - a partnership between [[Universal Music Group Nashville]] and [[Disney Music Group]]. It features Christian, Jay Clementi, Tyler Posey, Coutinho twins and Jim McCormick as songwriters on the track.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/repertory#ace/search/title/cool%20if%20you%20wanna|title=ACE Repertory|last=ACE|website=www.ascap.com|access-date=2018-09-30}} In December 2017, CB30 released a cover of the popular Christmas carol “[[The Christmas Song]]” and performed the song during [[ABC Studios|ABC]]’s CMA Country Christmas at the [[Grand Ole Opry]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/cb30-christmas-song-video/|title=CB30 Captures the Holiday Spirit in 'The Christmas Song' Video|date=2017-12-17|work=Sounds Like Nashville|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en-US}} The duo released their third song "Like It’s A Bad Thing," written by Christian and Jay Clementi and Kevin Bard,{{Cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/repertory#ace/search/title/like%20it's%20a%20bad%20thing|title=ACE Repertory|last=ACE|website=www.ascap.com|access-date=2018-09-30}} in April 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://www.umgnashville.com/news/cb30-releases-new-single-like-bad-thing/|title=CB30 Releases New Single "Like It's a Bad Thing"|last=|first=|date=|website=www.umgnashville.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2018-09-30}} They made their debut performance with the song at the 2018 Stagecoach Festival on the SiriusXM Spotlight Stage.{{Cite news|url=http://celebsecretscountry.com/2018/05/02/listen-to-cb30s-new-song-like-its-a-bad-thing-now/|title=Listen to CB30's New Song "Like It's A Bad Thing" Now|date=2018-05-02|work=Celeb Secrets Country|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.cb30music.com/news/stagecoach-2018|title=Stagecoach 2018|date=2018-02-23|work=CB30|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en}} In June 2018, CB30 performed during [[Country Music Association|CMA Fest]] at the [[Radio Disney]] Country Stage.{{Cite news|url=https://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/music/2018/05/18/trent-harmon-jordan-davis-cam-more-play-radio-disney-stage-cma-fest/617023002/|title=Trent Harmon, Jordan Davis, Cam, more to play Radio Disney Country Stage at CMA Fest|work=The Tennessean|access-date=2018-09-30|language=en}} The brothers identify [[Ed Sheeran]] and [[The Everly Brothers]] as some of their influences. Their debut album was originally expected in 2018, but was never released. In 2022 they released their track "Don't Say Goodnight" {{Cite news|url=https://strm.to/DontSayGoodnightWE |title=CB30 - Don't Say Goodnight }} Their "Old Phone" Official Music Video is also available{{Cite news|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aBocd37obZU |title=CB30 - "Old Phone" Official Music Video }} and previously went viral on TikTok.{{citation needed|date=December 2023}} == Discography == {| class="wikitable" |+ !TITLE !DATE !ALBUM |- |"Marina" |2016 |Non-album single |- |"Cool If Ya Wanna" |2017 |Non-album single |- |The Christmas Song" |2017 |Non-album single |- |"Like It's A Bad Thing" |2017 |Non-album single |} ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:American country music duos]] [[Category:Country music groups from Tennessee]] [[Category:Musical groups from Nashville, Tennessee]]
